This place reminds me of those small roadside eateries in China where they focus on simple but satisfying dishes. The flavors are clean, and doesn't seem like they use MSG. Bring some extra people to try a bunch of dishes together.
author: Susan H.

description:
I was walking around the neighborhood looking for a quick lunch before a meeting. This place looked welcoming, had one open table and a friendly yet busy waitress to welcome me in.

I am glad I did, the service was attentive, food was fresh and flavorful and the entire experience was really enjoyable. 

I am not usually a fan of a small hole in the wall type of place, but I was very surprised by how good this spot was. 

I will be back!
author: Jason L.

description: This is now my favorite place to grab authentic Chinese food.  The hand pulled beef soup noodles were absolutely delicious.  Wide assortment of appetizers to choose from as well.  Check this place out if you're looking for Chinese.  A little hole-in-the-wall with excellent, attentive and friendly service.
author: Alex B.

description: Almost left when I saw the menu since the dishes are not traditional Xi'an food. But the hand-made noodle and dumplings I ordered turned out really good. Worth to try!
author: Louis L.

description: Thought the food was only okay. The noodles and the steam dumplings are definitely the stars of the place.
author: H H.

description: If you value food over stylized ambience in a restaurant, this place should be on your list. A homey & and relaxed atmosphere, with friendly service, and the Hong Kong native in our party vouched for its authenticity. The traditional favorites we tried came off well, as did the items I picked specifically because I'd never had them elsewhere (Honey Chili Tofu, Beef Pancake, Boiled Corn & Chicken Dumpling and -- for dessert -- Boiled Black Sesame Mochi.)
author: Ken A.

description: It is the worst dumping I have tried. The service is so bad. They even shouted at my friend's mom. I will never go to this dumping anymore!
author: Wenru Z.

description: I don't know why this place has such low reviews but the food is delicious! I ordered the beef noodle soup, tendon noodle soup and the XLB.
author: Yvonne F.

description: I have to say I am always excited to find a good dumpling place and the fact that it's in Chinatown just made my day.  The xiao long bao is delicious! The wrapper is thin and it's so juicy when you bite into it.  The noodles are all made fresh with the guys right in front of you.  Also must tries are the beef tendon noodle soup and the beef pan cakes.
author: Ivy T.

description: Finally tried this place--went when it opened, no line, no problem.  The hand pulled noodles in soup was delicious, silky smooth.  I had the one with beef tendon and the broth was amazing.  We also had an order of Shanghai dumplings and the chicken and chive dumplings.  The Shanghai dumplings were good (although I've had better) and would order it again.  The other dumpling was so-so, the skin was very thick.  We also found out that for $1 per order, you can order fresh, uncooked noodles to go, so we took home 2 containers and will make our own broth and fixings at home.  Would definitely go back.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Love the hand-pulled noodles here. Do not love the curry fish balls...strange.
Their Shanghai dumplings are okay, as well, though think I need to try elsewhere to get a better comparison.

House of Nan King is next door, so if you're hungry and don't want to wait in that huge line, come here, instead...IMHO, much better, though not as many choices.
author: do i.

description: Pretty good dumplings. The service was fast, went in on a Sunday evening. There wasn't a wait like some of the better known restaurants in the area. The XLB was really good and hit the spot perfectly.
author: Maya A.

description: The braised tendon noodles in soup was actually very good! The noodle texture was great.  The wait wasn't as long as others had mentioned.  But the tea was warm and kind of flavorless.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Get here before the lunch crowd & you won't regret it. This place is well run & clean. Even when the lunch crowd did arrive, the one lady who served and rung up people's bills performed all this effortlessly!

We tried the lamb dumplings and pan fried pork buns. They were tasty! Plus, we got to see a man in the cart making noodles before our eyes. Took home a take-out menu to continue the experience.
author: C O.

description: Right on the edge of Financial District and Chinatown, House of Xian Dumpling is a busy spot that puts out decent Chinese food. Although not gourmet, a lot of their dishes feature noodles that are hand pulled by an employee that's sitting behind a glass wall for people to watch. Their noodle dishes are okay, although I prefer their soup noodles to the greasier chow mein. I would recommend going with their buns and dumplings as they were a little more authentic in my opinion. The dumplings come in several different filling choices, but all have a great texture to the dough. Though the dumplings are small, the ratio of filling to dough is just right. I also loved their pan-fried pork buns, which get a nice grilled char on the bottoms, but have that same juicy pork in the middle. Other dishes like the green onion pancake and fried rice were a little too oily for my taste, but all in all the meal was satisfying.
author: Ashley T.

description: Seated us immediately and had very good food. Chinese broccoli was on par! I would def come back and order the hand pulled Chinese noodles with beef
author: Oscar J N.

description:
The House of Xian Dumpling is one of my favorite SF restaurants right now. The food is amazing, and the staff is very pleasant and welcoming. I highly recommend the Beef Noodle Soup and the Soup Dumplings...WOW!!! Ignore all reviews below 4 stars, this place is up there with the best in Chinatown!

Enjoy and happy dining!!!
author: Erik K.

description: For a Chinatown restaurant in SF I was surprised that it was pretty clean! even the bathroom! My friends and I only ordered the soup filled dumplings.  We were all satisfied! There were only 4 other tables besides my group (which was the biggest) that were there at the time (around 4:30pm). No issues with service. If I come back to SF, I'll be back!
author: A L.

description: Great place to have homemade soup and dumplings on a cool/cold day. Definitely my new spot in SFO. Affordable too and friendly staff.
author: Elly C.

description: The staff seems overwhelmed by the intensity of it all, be prepared to spend at least one hour for lunch. The corn/chicken dumplings were nasty, maybe an off day, but everything else was ok. My food came out a full 20 minutes after my gf had hers, I also had to ask for the check 4 times. It's a good place but the amateurish staff with that 'end of the world' feeling makes me not want to go back.
author: Puddy C.

description: Had lunch there with my wife. Quite decent dim sum and excellent noodles. Will recommend!
author: Jay F.

description:
In short, the food here is better than some people let on in the other reviews. I have been there several times since their opening and they now worked out many of their kinks and have all their items on their menu available. The food has also improved a lot, the dishes are very flavorful.
I'd recommend ordering the shanghai soup dumpling (xiao long bao) because they are the best on this side of the city. Get the pork and chive dumplings and shanghai pan fried pork buns too. If you have room for dessert try their black sesame mochi because those are also on point!
Atmosphere is typical of a Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. Prices aren't too steep. Wait staff are nicer than normal Chinese restaurants. Try this place despite the number of older reviews.
author: Ava C.

description: Everything was alright but nothing was spectacular. Being so close to some authentic Chinese it didn't stand out.
author: Danielle A.

description: Excellent food. The hostess was very nice. She accommodated my very poor mandarin. The food is excellent. I came for the shau long bao and the beef noodle soup. I wasn't disappointed. I'll come back!
author: Brett S.

description: just so so.  could use more work to make the green onion pancake more delectable.
author: Jenny C.

description: Don't even come here to eat.  Terrible foods and terrible services.  Worst beef noodle I've ever had.  Half of the menu not available. Even the noodle that they boasted about is not good.  The Broth was tasteless and the beef was dry and not properly cooked.
author: JQ L.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING.  I have been to House of House of Xian Dumpling and that was on the top of my list. I went there for their famous Xi Long Bun and beef noodle soup for my girl friend's birthday! All food was super awesome and the waitress were super friendly too, it worthy to go back again!
author: Louis N.

description:
10/19/2013
I went with my wife to this place for dinner because she went there the previous week and enjoyed the meal.  
11/1/2013
Last night, we went to have dinner, but this time, the experience was quite the opposite from her previous experience.  First, they mixed up our dumpling order, and then, the noodle bowl that my wife ordered contained nothing but cheap, and what I labeled as "junk" vegetables.  The slices of zucchini added to the noodles tasted funny, like it was spoiled or out of date already.  When they came back with the dumplings, instead of chives, it was substituted with cabbage instead.  It looks like the dumplings were not hand-made, but purchased from a store. We didn't see anybody making the noodles inside the kitchen.  
I had a bowl beef tendon noodles and it wasn't bad.  
The food is tasty, I will admit, but still not what my wife had envisioned from previous experience.  She said she will not return. I went with my wife to this place for dinner because she went there the previous week and enjoyed the meal.  
Last night, we went to have dinner, but this time, the experience was quite the opposite from her previous experience.  First, they mixed up our dumpling order, and then, the noodle bowl that my wife ordered contained nothing but cheap, and what I labeled as "junk" vegetables.  The slices of zucchini added to the noodles tasted funny, like it was spoiled or out of date already.  When they came back with the dumplings, instead of chives, it was substituted with cabbage instead.  It looks like the dumplings were not hand-made, but purchased from a store. We didn't see anybody making the noodles inside the kitchen.  
I had a bowl beef tendon noodles and it wasn't bad.  
The food is tasty, I will admit, but still not what my wife had envisioned from previous experience.  She said she will not return.
author: V, G.

description: We were looking on yelp for dumpings near our hotel and found this. Despite the lower rating we decided to come right before they were closing. The service was fast because of this and the food was great and the price cheap. We ordered the dumplings and the dumplings with the soup inside it. Excellent. If I had more time I would have looked at the menu and yelp longer to order the noodles. Sucked we missed out of that. Later that night we went to a very popular ramen restaurant where we waited an hour and had 3000+ reviews and the food was totally not worth it. Goes to show you that sometimes yelp is hit or miss.
author: Adalia K.

description: Dumplings are really good. However, expecting a long wait for the food and check.
author: Sean C.

description: this place is very good. The dumpling is very tasty. Always busy. Also the staff are friendly. Everything is great.The fried rice is my favorite and Shanghai dumpling.
author: Louis N.

description: I got take out beef noodle soup with flat handpulled noodles at lunch time on 2/19/15. I got 2 orders for my colleague and I. I took it back to my office. They give you 2 containers to separate the beef from the noodles. I was about to pour the soup into the noodle container but it was so hot so I decided to put some of the noodles into the soup container instead. So I add some noodles to the soup a little at a time but as im eating I am noticing the noodles had brownish flecks in them. I was thinking it was just like that from the broth. But then I look in the noodle container and instead of the noodles being all white, I see that they are flecked even before I put it into the soup. The noodles are very sticky without the broth so I start pulling it apart and inspecting it closer. I see that there are indeed brownish green spots and I realize, its MOLD. My colleague's was the same. In hers we found an even bigger piece of mold, about half the size of a dime. I also bought some boiled dumplings and that was fine, but needless to say I am never going back. I can't help thinking that if I was eating at the restaurant, I never would have been able to tell that there was mold in the noodles as it would already be mixed in with the soup.
author: David L.

description: Excellent beef noodle soup, best I found in Chinatown during a trip to San Francisco!!
author: Jonathan V.

description: I work in Chinatown so I've tried a lot of places, and this is a favorite. "Meat slices in thick gravy noodle soup" might not sound too appealing, but it was delicious. It actually had more veg than meat. The soup dumplings were OK, but I really love the pork and cabbage dumplings, either in soup or on their own. The waitresses I've met all speak English well, so you can ask lots of questions if you need to.
author: Ingrid F.

description: Went here for lunch today. Ordered 3 items - one came after a 30 minute wait. The other 2 items never came, after waiting a total of one hour. I repeatedly saw the dishes of neighboring tables who had arrived much later than me get served before me. I made several attempts to question the two waitresses about the status of my order, but both waitresses seemed lost, confused, and clueless. The response of one of the waitresses was simply "if it's not coming out of the kitchen yet, there's nothing I can do about it." She seemed too scared to even go into the kitchen to check on my order. I ended up canceling my order for the two items, as I had to return to work. The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because the waitress decided to comp us the 1 item (fried rice) at the end, after my cousin gave her an angry look of disapproval while paying. As for the fried rice itself, it was not bad. I may try coming back here in a few months again, after they get their act together, but for now, I'd go elsewhere.
author: Grace M.

description: Amazing and definitely go! Onion pancakes and the Beijing (Fried) mini buns with condensed milk---YUM...actually everything on the menu is really good and for that price (cheap) works! Also, noddles and dumplings are home-made with the chef behind a plastic stall making them.
author: J. S.

description: With friends went there for lunch, waited so long and the food was only okay. Everything was just so so so slow.
author: Yuna Y.

description: my sister and I went in here so hungry, and came out soooo full and happy. i had the veggie hand pulled noodle soup (which the server told me was made with veg broth, which as a vegetarian was awesome to know!) and my sister got soup dumplings. everything was delicious, fast, and affordable. would def go again.
author: A R.
